title: Donations
text:
I recently took the trial pledge at Giving What We Can, and I’ve been donating to GiveWell. Here is my first year of donations.


Code
from graph_donations import Donation, graph_donations
from datetime import date

sigma = 8  # controls spread of the diffusion (in days)
padding_days = 30

# Sample data
first_donation = Donation(date(2024, 2, 15), 5181.30)
second_donation = Donation(date(2024, 9, 16), 7318.04)
third_donation = Donation(date(2024, 10, 10), 15774.05)
donations = [first_donation, second_donation, third_donation]

diffused_amounts = graph_donations(
  sigma,
  padding_days,
  donations
)









This plot is my donations with a diffusion kernel applied just to smooth them out.

title: Home
text:
This is where I’m testing learning about Quarto
As some example content to tinker with, I killed two birds with one stone and made a page about recent donations to GiveWell. I wanted to plot recent donations, and I wanted to see if I could smooth them out over time, and I think it worked nicely.
One remaining item I have for learning quarto is figuring out how to publish it to github pages.
